cause.description:
Youth Vote Overseas is the name of the young voter outreach program of Overseas Vote Foundation (OVF), a nonprofit, nonpartisan 501(c)(3) public charity.
Youth Vote Overseas is a nonpartisan volunteer network for young Americans living around the world who want to inform others in their own age group about their right to vote from abroad and to encourage and assist them to register to vote and apply for an absentee ballot.
OVF provides outreach materials and its online voter tools to Youth Vote Overseas – the full selection of services is available to all voters at
http://yvo.overseasvotefoundation.org.
For more information contact: youth@overseasvotefoundation.org
1. We are the future of our country and we all have a voice!
2. US citizens can vote absentee in federal elections from anywhere in the world – it is important to inform each other of this right.
3. Young people who start voting as soon as they are eligible tend to be active electors throughout their lives.
4. Voters who live outside the country often become much more keenly aware of how the US affects the world with its foreign policy and of the importance and value of their right to vote.
5. Voting and assisting others to register to vote and apply for an absentee ballot helps keep citizens connected to the electoral process at home.
6. By setting an example, young voters abroad have the potential to stimulate voter interest and participation at home as well as abroad.
cause.mission: Increase electoral participation of young US citizens living outside the United States.
cause.name: Youth Vote Overseas
